title: What is the best way to find new indie music? - Quora

response.answer_text: on spotify you can go into your daily mixes and they give song suggestions based off your other listening.If you click on an artist on spotify and scroll down u can see and section saying: fans also like. This will give a selection of similar bands.On youtube watch interviews of bands u like and they often give shoutouts to other bands touring with them. Also just research bands touring with bands u like. These will usually be smaller bands basically no one has heard of.Listen to Nothing but thieves😂 These are an awesome indie rock band who i’m absolutely in love with at the moment they are so awesome. The vocalist has an insanely good voice. I’ve found a lot of new bands by watching interviews. They give a lot of shoutouts to supports new bands. This songs called Hanging by them. This is live as well and personally i think it’s better live than on spotify which says a lot:

I am a member of Jukely, a service that offers admission to a new touring band almost every night of the week. It’s not just indie, but researching the different options can get you a nightly live show from reliably good bands. My favorite site for reviews and recommendations is Metacritic. Metacritic uses math to quantify reviews from Pitchfork, Rolling Stone, AllMusic, NME, The AV Club, Consequence of Sound, Paste, and Under the Radar, among others. Other good blogs include All Songs Considered by NPR, their Tiny Desk Concerts are a great introduction to indie bands and Seattle’s KEXP which podcasts and videos Seattle and national indie acts.
